subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 1095
msgSnippet: ... Hansel is also good, and it works in Eclipse, so should also work fine in WSAD. Hansel is nice within the IDE because it gives you immediate feedback when
messageBody:
Vladimir Ritz Bossicard wrote:
>
>>> murukeshcts wrote:
>>>
>>
>>>> > hai all,
>>>> > Is there any tool available..that i can integrated with WSAD so that
>>>> > i can check for the code coverage of the JUnitcode which a person
>>>> > writes in his project.
>>
>>>
>>> I don't know about WSAD integration, but there are several test coverage
>>> tools out there, including Clover and Jester. They are easily integrated
>>> with Ant.
>
>
> jcoverage <http://www.jcoverage.com> works nicely too

Hansel is also good, and it works in Eclipse, so should also work fine in WSAD.
Hansel is nice within the IDE because it gives you immediate feedback when
running the test, and you can click on the error line in the integrated JUnit
runner and go directly to the uncovered code.

-- Chad
